dmca.title: Blogger DMCA Complaint- Linda Ellis
dmca.body: Below is my good faith statement and copyright information. Several sites hosted by blogspot.com have my copyrighted work, "The Dash" posted unauthorized and mostly unaccredited. The copyright # as filed with the Library of Congress for this work is Txu 858-108. I have contacted you previously regarding this problem and these are current sites found from a Google search. Thank you. I am notifiyng you of the EXACT blogspot urls where your users have MY copyrighted work posted illegally. The EXACT wording from the copyrighted work is included in this email. Some of your users have changed the title (maybe so we couldn't find their misuse?), but the poem is the exact wording from below. Don't write me back again and say you couldn't locate THEM!!! YOU HAVE EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO ACT UPON THIS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY, INCLUDING MY SIGNED, SWORN STATEMENT. I have to do this same thing with Yahoo and many others and they are very cooperative. Google doesn't seem interested in stopping the illegal use of my work. I usually receive an email in return from you saying that you couldn't find it! Well, I assure you, you can find it on every one of these sites below if you simply take the time to do so!! Please have your users remove this material immediately. I thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Linda Ellis www.lindaellis.net INFORMATION AS REQUESTED CONCERNING A COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT OF MY WORK BY MANY OF YOUR MEMBERS: 1. A description of the copyrighted work or other intellectual property that you claim has been infringed; Poem titled The Dash, which is under registered copyright # TXu 858-108. Text is included at the end of this email. 2. A description of the location where the material that you claim is infringing is located; The poem is posted unauthorized and mostly unaccredited on the blogspot.Com sites listed at the end of this email. 3. A statement by you that you have a good faith belief that the reported use is not authorized by the copyright or intellectual property owner, its agent, or the law; I hereby state that permission was never granted for use of this copyrighted work on the web sites sent here by myself, the author and copyright owner, or any agents or representatives of my company, Linda's Lyrics. 4. Your address, telephone number, and, if available, e-mail address; Linda Ellis Linda's Lyrics 1050 E. Piedmont Road Suite E-135 Marietta. GA 30062 lellis@bellsouth.net 404-966-3349 5. A statement by you, made under penalty of perjury, that the above information is accurate and that you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or authorized to act on the copyright or intellectual property owner's behalf; and Under penalty of perjury, I hereby state that the above information is accurate and that I am the copyright owner of the material posted unaccredited and unauthorized on the web sites contained in this email. 6. An electronic or physical signature by the person making the submission (i.e., you or such other person authorized to act on behalf of the complaining party). If the submission is made electronically, the authorized person making the submission should designate his or her electronic signature by typing a forward slash ("/") before and after his or her typed name and follow this electronic signature by again typing his or her name. Linda's Lyrics 1050 E. Was the dash between those years (1934 - 1998) For that dash represents all the time That she spent alive on earth And now only those who loved her, ... oneforjc blogspot Com/2005_11_01_oneforjc_archive HTML - 76k - Cached - Similar pages munavoloav since 1986: Julv 2004 was the dash between those years For that dash represents all the time that she spent alive on earth, and now only those who loved her know ... mungyo blogspot Com/2004_07_01_mungyo_archive HTML - 58k - Cached - Similar pages Hepburn In New Zealand Was the "Dash" between those years For, that "dash" represents all The time that he spent on earth And now only those who loved him ... hepburnnz blogspot coml - 218k - Oct 30,2006 - Cached - Similar pages The Dash by Linda Ellis Copyright Txu-858-108 I read of a man who stood to speak at the funeral of a friend. He referred to the dates on her tombstone from the beginning ... to the end. He noted that first came the date of her birth and spoke of the following date with tears, but he said what mattered most of all was the dash between those years. For that dash represents all the time that she spent alive on earth and now only those who loved her know what that little line is worth. For it matters not, how much we own, the cars, the house, the cash. What matters is how we live and love and how we spend our dash. So think about this long and hard, are there things you'd like to change? For you never know how much time is left that can still be rearranged. If we could just slow down enough to consider what's true and real and always try to understand the way other people feel. And be less quick to anger and show appreciation more and love the people in our lives like we've never loved before. If we treat each other with respect and more often wear a smile remembering that this special dash might only last a little while. So when your eulogy is being read with your life's actions to rehash, would you be proud of the things they say about how you spent your dash?
